padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1962450" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tabi_Cat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1854877"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tabi_Cat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1962450ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1962450" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); Feminine, floral and green. Smells like the whole tulip from the stem to the petals in the nicest way and has a uniqueness to it. It doesnt have much lasting power but stronger than other byredo scents. I could smell it on my from time to time but only faintly. Too expensive to be worth it but gorgeous smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1962450"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1962450#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1961948" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1961948" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thaochipnd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579302"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1579302.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thaochipnd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Olene-Eau-de-Toilette-3960.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3960.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Olene Eau de Toilette"title="Olene Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1961948ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1961948" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579302">thaochipnd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-27">10/27/23 02:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love it! The Tulip scent is fresh, elegant and extremely pleasant. Tulips sway in the gentle breeze, and the clear night dew reflects on the petals, recalling memories of romantic suburbs. It's like I'm lying on a hill of Tulip flowers with green grass in the Netherlands, so peaceful. If you are a luxury and elegant girl, definitely don't miss this wonderful fragrance. The scent ups my mood every morning.<br />
<br />
Rating: 9/10, my most favorite elegant perfume</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1961948"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1961948#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1959307" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1959307" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="karlovonamesti"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.19849.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="karlovonamesti" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1959307ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1959307" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849">karlovonamesti</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-23">10/23/23 18:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In 2003, Bond No 9 released Chelsea Flowers, which was seemingly a spin on Tommy Girl, where the florals were amplified, and the blackcurrant eliminated. Laurent Le Guernec opted to render these florals as if you had stuck your nose in a grocery store bouquet, dewey, wet, ambiguously sweet, unambiguously bitter-green and stemmy. La Tulipe fine-tunes this approach, lending it some focus by overlaying the central vegetal greenness with an immensely powdery-floral musk. The result is breathtaking, a much more successful direction to take this nondescript floral idea, and something I truly admire. Occasionally, it makes me think of Jacomo's long-forgotten Silences.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1959307"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1959307#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1954969" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1954969" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="billiedenise"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1842879"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1842879.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="billiedenise" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mind-Games/Queening-89898.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89898.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Queening"title="Queening"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1954969ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1954969" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1842879">billiedenise</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-18">10/18/23 07:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I recently ordered a ton of decants from Byredo to explore the brand's different fragrances. This is the first one I sampled from them. It's smells like Spring: green, light, clean, fresh and a little sweet floral. When you breathe it in and close your eyes you can see a tulip, surrounded by green, covered in raindrops from a morning spring rain shower. A wonderfully light, clean scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1954969"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1954969#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1926207" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1926207" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Enrium"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36833"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.36833.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Enrium" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-46885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You"title="You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1926207ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1926207" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36833">Enrium</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-12">09/12/23 11:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tulips (or at least the ones I've smelled) don't have a scent, and La Tulipe is an impression of what a tulip would smell like. The resulting scent is a clean, minimal, realistic floral scent with a green undertone. It is a dewy floral, the waxiness of the petals evident. <br />
<br />
LT opens with a clean, light white floral accord, initially most reminiscent of a very muted, polite tuberose (far from the true nature of that actual flower!). It quickly develops to reveal a sweet, slightly aquatic freesia note. Freesia feels very dated to me, as it was overused in floral-fruities of the ninetie/noughties. Still, the fresh green undertone complements it nicely and there is a slight tartness thanks to the rhubarb note.<br />
<br />
As it develops, the soft woody base emerges, a predictable but pleasant accord that complements the clean, sweet florals nicely. It becomes slightly musky as it fades, the woody florals remaining until final fade. Sillage and longevity are moderate. <br />
<br />
A pleasant, polite floral, LT is an understated feminine scent that is ideal for everyday wear. Nothing particularly exciting or unusual, and feels a little dated to me. Still, a decent, good-quality scent overall with a cool source of inspiration. 3/5.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1926207"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1926207#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1898192" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1898192" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Laviejojo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410237"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1410237.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Laviejojo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1898192ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1898192" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410237">Laviejojo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 18:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Simple and pretty.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1898192"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1898192#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1888134" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1888134" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Julietrenoir"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1801708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Julietrenoir" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1888134ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1888134" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1801708">Julietrenoir</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-27">07/27/23 07:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A cheaper dupe is Fleur de Mimosa by &amp;otherstories!! They are so similar and they are both created by Jrme Epinette.<br />
<br />
I love La Tulipe: it's simple, not too complex, just pure, essential and fresh. Makes me think about spring, a green field. Easy vibe!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1888134"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1888134#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1886493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1886493" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ava96"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1632572"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ava96" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Milk-69191.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69191.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Milk"title="Milk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1886493ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1886493" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1632572">ava96</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-25">07/25/23 04:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is like a much lighter and floral version of Blanche by Byredo which I hate. This one is okay because it is not so intense, but it smells exactly like washing powder or fabric softener.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1886493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1886493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1886014" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1886014" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sakrosankt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1425444"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1425444.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sakrosankt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Meliora-18750.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18750.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Meliora"title="Meliora"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1886014ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1886014" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1425444">sakrosankt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-24">07/24/23 12:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If the top notes would stay the whole day and project like the first hour, I wouldn't need any other perfume. Okay, who am I kidding? Trying out different scents is just too much fun!<br />
<br />
But! This is such a lovely and imho unique floral perfume, which is difficult to achieve, since florals are such a popular scent profile. It is the painting of a tulip. At least the tulips I know do not smell like this. And still... when you smell it, you picture tulips in full bloom with little rain dropplets on them. But my clothes smell of unremarkable soapy perfume when I take them off in the evening. After 5 years I used over half a bottle and if finances allow it, I'll never be without it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1886014"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1886014#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1883481" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1883481" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kitkatya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1762795"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1762795.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kitkatya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dame-Perfumery/Soliflore-Orange-Flower-39862.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39862.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soliflore Orange Flower"title="Soliflore Orange Flower"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1883481ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1883481" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1762795">kitkatya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-20">07/20/23 23:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>a tulip drenched in springtime morning dew, or even nestled in late winter fresh fallen snow, snipped precisely with shears. it smells like a fresh-clipped stem with sweet blooms that will never wilt, a young tulip somehow eternally kept from age. <br />
<br />
i am OBSESSED with this, i am in LOVE with it, it's my ultimate clean scent and everything i want in a fresh floral!! tulips have long been my favorite flower, not for their smell but for some unnameable quality i think this perfume beautifully replicates. i first smelled this in a niche shop in italy and adored it on paper; the saleswoman kindly gifted me a sample vial, and i found that on my skin, it transforms into a fresh spicy beauty the minute it dries, and i fell in deep deep love...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1883481"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1883481#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1881391" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1881391" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RottigrlNYC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191473"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191473.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RottigrlNYC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1881391ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1881391" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191473">RottigrlNYC</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-18">07/18/23 08:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its ok. Its nice but doesnt last and it doesnt project . Its a pretty scent tho. I bought the three 10ml travel size sprays and its more than enough. I only wear this in Spring and Summer.<br />
The lady at the supermarket checkout   asked me what perfume Im wearing. I said why? She said so she can be sure never to buy this nasty smelling thing . No accounting for taste. I told her dont worry, youll never be able to afford it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1881391"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1881391#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1864327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I will get me a bottle for sure</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1864327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1864327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1860797" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1860797" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sandra_101"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674985"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1674985.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sandra_101" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Carnal-Flower-1024.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1024.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Carnal Flower"title="Carnal Flower"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1860797ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1860797" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674985">sandra_101</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-20">06/20/23 13:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It really does smell like tulips. Or at least it gives a scent image of them (maybe it's mostly suggestion from the name idk). Like a bouquet where you smell the cut stems and leaves. There's that distinctly Byredo laundry detergent thing going on, too. A clean, woody laundry detergent backbone has been in all the samples I've tried so far in the discovery set.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1860797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1860797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1841782" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1841782" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mirena.1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1030086.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mirena.1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1841782ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1841782" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030086">mirena.1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-25">05/25/23 18:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance represents the moment when there is still fresh, fluffy snow but the first, spring flowers came up under the ground and bring us the first spring scents.<br />
Love that fragrance! It's clear without being soapy, it's fresh without citruses. It's clear flower scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1841782"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1841782#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1831964" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Very "wet", a dewy spring morning in the garden. Really nice and fresh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1831964"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1831964#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1824486" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1824486" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gandrasta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15995"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.15995.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gandrasta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/M7-1031.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1031.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="M7"title="M7"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1824486ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1824486" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15995">gandrasta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-04">05/04/23 02:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soapy, flower and spice. Love to experience non citrusy fresh of this fragrance. There's an earthy note that gives depth and complexity throughout the dry down. Stays surprisingly longer than expected</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1824486"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1824486#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1821311" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1821311" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bleuetfane"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1738697"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1738697.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bleuetfane" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1821311ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1821311" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1738697">bleuetfane</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-30">04/30/23 04:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A dew-drenched garden, yes, but not a fresh, morning one. This is a cold, powdery and sharp floral, evocative of a night-time garden, or the smell of a flower shop mixed with the chemical sharpness of a florists spray. This is something I imagine Jean Harlow to wear in her silk-and-feathered boudoir in Dinner at Eight. The freesia gives it a bit of a fancy, heavy-scented soap quality, reminiscent of a lily of the valley, not at all like something found in, say, Replicaa Bubble Bath. It can be quite heavy, especially in hot or humid weather, which makes it more of an evening or rainy day perfume. The projection is moderate, and it lasts quite a long time, especially on clothes. <br />
<br />
Layering with Jo Malones Red Roses balances the powderness with some greenery, making it a bit lighter and day-time appropriate. Heavenly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1821311"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1821311#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1798396" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1798396" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NiNhi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1716684"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="NiNhi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1798396ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1798396" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1716684">NiNhi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-01">04/01/23 21:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this is stayed on my skin longer than the Bal D'afrique even I love that one more than this. <br />
This is a simply lovely floral scent. Very uplifting, fresh and sweet. People around will adore you with this scent.<br />
It just not my taste, I prefer woody and spicy floral. <br />
For my liking of green floral fragrance if would choose Miu Miu (yellow cap) over this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1798396"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1798396#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1797204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1797204" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clariella"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1034512"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1034512.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="clariella" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lalique/Pink-Paradise-51397.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51397.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pink Paradise"title="Pink Paradise"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1797204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1797204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1034512">clariella</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-31">03/31/23 11:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've been using a sample of this lovely fragrance for a while now, and I love it. It's very interesting, and long lasting, and the character of the scent changes very much during the day when I wear it.<br />
The opening is fresh, clean and green, a lot of rhubarb and some floral notes (I suppose it's the freesia, tulip and cyclamen, but to me it mostly smells green and generally floral). The dry down is slightly woody with some almost musky undertones, even if musk isn't listed as a note. On my skin it just turns out that way, and it's very pleasant.<br />
Over all I really like this fragrance, and I'll buy a full bottle as soon as I can afford to do so.<br />
It stays somewhat close to the skin, and on me it is very long lasting, I'm talking about 8h +.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1797204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1797204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1791274" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1791274" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Apaolone04"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596253"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1596253.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Apaolone04" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Omnia-Profumi/Madera-9534.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9534.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madera"title="Madera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1791274ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1791274" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596253">Apaolone04</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-23">03/23/23 23:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is my current obsession! Spring just started where I live, I found it for a good price and Im really glad I got it. I went to Saks for the first time a month ago, first thing I did was I smell the entire Byredo collection. This one to my surprise stood out, Im normally a sweet lover. Its nothing crazy, it was just so realistic and beautiful. Ive never smelled a tulip but this scent made me believe I had. The longevity is low to moderate like most byredo perfumes but I must say it projects quite nicely. I dont even have to overspray too much to get a good scent bubble going on, unless 10 sprays is excessive to you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1791274"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1791274#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1786172" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1786172" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WhiteFlowerPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WhiteFlowerPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Lucky-48385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lucky"title="Lucky"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1786172ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1786172" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712">WhiteFlowerPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-17">03/17/23 18:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This isn't bad, but it reminds me slightly of air freshener. It's very clean, safe and slightly artifical smelling. I wouldn't mind my house or apartment smelling like this, but I certainly wouldn't want to smell like this! I think it's the combination of the freesia and the green noted giving me this impression of the fragrance of a house. I've never particularly liked the smell of freesia. The rhubarb smells quite bitter, too.<br />
<br />
In summary, a very average perfume in my opinion. It does have moderate projection and sillage, though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1786172"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1786172#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1773022" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1773022" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="xxdarkstarxx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254012"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254012.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="xxdarkstarxx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Sakura-48379.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48379.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sakura"title="Sakura"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1773022ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1773022" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254012">xxdarkstarxx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-02">03/02/23 07:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you like clean - like detergent clean fragrances give this one a shot. <br />
<br />
In the initial blast I get straight up Palmolive Clean Liquid Dish Soap - you know the green one. After a couple of minutes I can smell the fresh tulips that are placed in a crystal clear vase with cold water &amp; the scent of the bubbles from using Palmolive Clean Liquid Dish Soap. Imagine walking by this vase as the breeze comes in from an open window and you can smell those fresh tulips. It's not a sweet floral scent... it's more on the green floral side of things. This fragrance is super breezy, super fresh, super clean, and on my skin it last and projects beautifully. It is smack down unisex &amp; can be a perfect gym fragrance since it smells like a fresh load of laundry. I love my fresh fragrances with Blanche being my #1 choice but maybe ill purchase a 50ml of this one...still debating since I can't shake off the Palmolive Clean Liquid Dish Soap scent I get with this but I do love to smell squeaky clean sometimes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1773022"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1773022#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1759181" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; A little off putting in the sillage but nose to wrist its pretty and purely floral.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1759181"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1759181#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1752925" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1752925" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Violinist"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1623794"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1623794.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Violinist" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/En-Passant-2793.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2793.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="En Passant"title="En Passant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1752925ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1752925" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1623794">Violinist</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-05">02/05/23 17:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tulip perfection. I absolutely love this perfume. I understand the thought about a sharp note on the top (rhubarb?), but for me, its not off-putting and adds to the complexity, interest and sophistication of the scent. The dry-down is magicalthe tulip scent comes through beautifully, and I cant imagine tulip is an easy floral note to capture, but this one does it. Its one of the most beautiful floral scents in my collection and perhaps the best Ive ever smelled. Its a winner, winner, winner. This perfume makes me feel gorgeous.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1752925"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1752925#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1750374" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Besides that, clearly a lovely realistic tulip scent. Very feminine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1750374"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1750374#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1749626" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1749626" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SaraZigova"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SaraZigova" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1749626ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1749626" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);
