padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1448206" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GabrielleF"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1395080"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1395080.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GabrielleF" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1448206ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1448206" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1395080">GabrielleF</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-18">11/18/21 12:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm generally not a floral perfumes lover, but I love this one. A perfectly balanced concoction of floral, woodsy and green notes. t's comforting, captivating and vibrant, but it does ooze something innocent and pure. Strangely enough, my cat who stays away from me anytime I wear perfumes, doesn't mind this one at all</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1448206"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1448206#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1445853" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1445853" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ladydonttekno"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/822249"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.822249.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ladydonttekno" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Whiskey-Reserve-76785.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76785.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Whiskey Reserve"title="Whiskey Reserve"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1445853ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1445853" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/822249">ladydonttekno</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-14">11/14/21 14:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bright green spring floral with tart rhubarb (love this addition!) However, as with nearly every other Byredo offering I've tried, it has a soapy drydown that I can't stand. Aldehydes must be part of the Byredo DNA. What could have been the perfect tulip scent was ruined by it. The fast fade doesn't help, either.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1445853"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1445853#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1443885" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1443885" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brittanyandco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250070"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="brittanyandco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Mataha/Escapade-Gourmande-72607.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72607.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escapade Gourmande"title="Escapade Gourmande"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1443885ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1443885" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250070">brittanyandco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-11">11/11/21 04:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If the song "Les Fleurs" by Minnie Riperton were a perfume, it would smell like La Tulipe. A burst of flowers with a sweet and clean, almost soapy background. People always talk about other Byredo scents, but this one is beautiful and caught me completely by surprise.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1443885"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1443885#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1443798" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1443798" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="delightme5"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1172812"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="delightme5" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1443798ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1443798" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1172812">delightme5</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-10">11/10/21 22:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Comments seem to allude towards perfect for brides and generally not much more. Its in fact a perfectly unisex perfume. reen, sometimes soapy? Vaguely sweet - no tutti frutti. There is perhaps a vague synthetic feeling likely created by a water like note which is all part of this freshmess. This does not work well in cool to cold weather. For the pleasure to unfold, my experience shows use this only in warm to hot or humid like weather, where it shines a few different facets and brings out its best yellow greens.  Cold weather flattens this perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1443798"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1443798#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1429000" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1429000" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="evarosa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1266133"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1266133.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="evarosa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Iris-Perle-48539.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48539.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Perle"title="Iris Perle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1429000ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1429000" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1266133">evarosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-16">10/16/21 00:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow! This one really takes me back to my childhood. This is the kind of green floral scent that young women wore in the 1980's before the androgynous aquatic freshness of the 1990's hit us. <br />
<br />
There are notes like fig and heliotrope that I always associate to that time and even if they are not present in this fragrance there is the same sweetness.<br />
<br />
La Tulipe is quite close to something like Houbigant Quelques Fleurs. Of course for the younger crowd who don't have these recollections it's a perfectly nice sweet and green floral.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1429000"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1429000#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1412082" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1412082" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thestranger"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382004"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1382004.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thestranger" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1412082ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1412082" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); Something in the opening gave me a headache</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1412082"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1412082#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1407823" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1407823" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LavenderMilk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1197425"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1197425.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LavenderMilk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Matine/Poom-Poom-72488.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72488.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Poom Poom"title="Poom Poom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1407823ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1407823" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1197425">LavenderMilk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-10">09/10/21 10:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I LOVE how it smells. Whether you agree that this is a tulip, or not, it's natural-like, fresh like a tulip in the spring garden, full of youth, it's cheerful and fresh.<br />
<br />
Cartier Carat indeed smells like it, like a pretty teen sister of the celebrity which La Tulipe is.<br />
<br />
Parle moi des Parfum Totally White is not a tulip, it smells like a different flower, but the mood is very similar, they may be smells from almost the same time, from the same garden, but they are two friends, not sisters. Aerin Lauder Lilac Path is also a realistic, fresh, almost dewy spring flower scent, so you may try it as well if what you look for is a certain mood, not a certain flower. Or En Passant by Frederic Malle, which is another absolutely damn fabulous spring lilac.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1407823"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1407823#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1402188" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1402188" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KymIndigo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1368555"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1368555.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KymIndigo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Goldfield-Banks-Australia/Pacific-Rock-Moss-44120.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44120.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pacific Rock Moss"title="Pacific Rock Moss"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1402188ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1402188" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1368555">KymIndigo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-31">08/31/21 17:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What an absolutely gorgeous little gem! If I could sum up this perfume in one word it would be "innocent". This light and slightly green floral is the most natural floral scent I've found so far - if you close your eyes and smell La Tulipe you would never know it was even a perfume, it smells just like you've dipped your nose into a bunch of freesias. I find it lasts all day long when sprayed onto my neck, but only a few hours onto the wrist or arms. A spray directly onto clothing goes a long way in terms of longevity as well. If you love floral scents but prefer more green and natural rather than the usual sweet floral, this is the perfume for you!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1402188"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1402188#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1395761" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1395761" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maddsienicole"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362282"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1362282.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maddsienicole" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sana-Jardin/Sandalwood-Temple-46701.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46701.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sandalwood Temple"title="Sandalwood Temple"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1395761ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1395761" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362282">maddsienicole</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-20">08/20/21 11:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On a test strip, I got a complex rhubarb floral with really prominent, watery green notes that I could not stop sniffing. On skin, it's a realistic but one-dimensional tulip + freesia. Soapy, with no discernable transition between top, middle, and base notes. It's different enough between sample and full bottle that I was concerned the bottle I purchased had either gone bad or was a fake. Mediocre sillage and lasting power, not spectacular. My favorite scents are green florals, and this is different enough from the others I have that I'm happy to have a full bottle. But it's a daily wear that I spray abundantly, since it doesn't leave a trail and I don't particularly care about savoring it (and I'm not sure I would repurchase, once I run out.) I will say, everyone and their mom is wearing Bal D'Afrique, Bibliotheque, and Gypsy Water. If you want a signature scent from Byredo that you're not going to smell on everyone, I'd go for this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1395761"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1395761#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1394815" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1394815" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ckorp8"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1357605.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ckorp8" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/M-Micallef/Soleil-Passion-76111.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76111.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soleil Passion"title="Soleil Passion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1394815ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1394815" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357605">ckorp8</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-18">08/18/21 21:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Biblotheque is my favorite Byredo perfume and that got me buying other by the same brand. However, others I got keep disappointing. La Tulipe is the latest in this attempt and will probably be the last. The scent I got, asserted by others as being realistic tulip scent, though nice and not too generic,  isnt enough to keep me interested. My tulips certainly didnt smell like this from my memory. But anyway, the perfume as a whole is simply just mediocre to me.<br />
Bal dAfrique and Casablanca Lily are the other good enough Byredo perfumes in my collection fyi.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1394815"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1394815#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1393258" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1393258" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kterhark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/12596"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.12596.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kterhark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Agua-de-Sevilla/Agua-de-Naranjos-16229.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16229.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Agua de Naranjos"title="Agua de Naranjos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1393258ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1393258" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/12596">Kterhark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-16">08/16/21 09:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a difficult fragrance to review because nothing really stands out.  Is it a stinker? No.  Is it earth shattering?  No.  Is it the best floral green you'll ever try? no.  But it's also not the worst.  it's a middling fragrance, which are the hardest to review.  My final thoughts:  I would swap out the rhubard/reedy note and bring in something more harmonious.  Antonia's Flowers 'Absolu' is a good place to start for inspiration.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1393258"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1393258#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1388898" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1388898" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ghkim"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/663802"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.663802.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ghkim" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1388898ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1388898" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/663802">ghkim</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-08">08/08/21 13:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh floral fragrance perfect for spring with a slight woody dry down that keeps it from being too one dimensional. Nothing particularly earth shattering here, but it is a lovely light fragrance. Good for office or for when a strong fragrance is not a good idea. Better than a designer fragrance because of the balance and that subtle dry down. Similar in feel to gypsy water.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1388898"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1388898#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1386619" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1386619" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="camellia eve"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234662"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1234662.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="camellia eve" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ex-Idolo/Love-Crime-52069.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52069.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love & Crime"title="Love & Crime"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1386619ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1386619" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234662">camellia eve</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-04">08/04/21 13:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The tulip note smells quite like the real thing. If you're looking for a very tulip-like scent, try it out. Its a lovely scent, especially for spring time, however not one that I'd get a full size of. I scrolled the internet looking for something that resembles the YSL rouge volupte sheer candy lipstick or the tint-in-balm as I completely love the scent of them, someone recommended to try La Tulipe, unfortunately it wasn't it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1386619"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1386619#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1379939" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1379939" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cocoma"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1365413"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cocoma" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1379939ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1379939" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1365413">cocoma</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-22">07/22/21 11:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like when as a kid you'd go to the house of a friend and you meet their mom. Comforting and unique, but at the same time I don't want to smell like someone's mom, so this one is not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1379939"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1379939#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1364082" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1364082" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="s.pellegrino"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1202602"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1202602.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="s.pellegrino" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Violet/Un-Air-d-Apogee-48516.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48516.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Un Air dApoge"title="Un Air dApoge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1364082ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1364082" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1202602">s.pellegrino</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-22">06/22/21 09:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>La Tulipe is an absolutely lovely floral scent, that quite brilliantly manages to touch upon the sweet, fresh, and creamy aspects of the tulip (which, I would say, does have a subtle smell). Lotion-y and clean, yes, but in a way that immediately puts a big smile on my face. Having said that, I also fully agree with the reviewer below who notes that if your seven-year-old niece would smell like this, it would make total sense. This is one of those fragrances where I think I prefer to smell it, rather than to smell of it. I saw there is a hand cream, that might be the perfect way to briefly indulge in La Tulipe for me. But yes, utterly divine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1364082"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1364082#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1360846" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1360846" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AnnaElli"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1333554"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1333554.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AnnaElli" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Teo-Cabanel/Je-Ne-Sais-Quoi-64204.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64204.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Je Ne Sais Quoi"title="Je Ne Sais Quoi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1360846ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1360846" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1333554">AnnaElli</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-16">06/16/21 06:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Light, crisp, floral smell and so tulip-like, but a bit sweeter. I like when scent smell authentic to the notes. Even if I get the soapy reference in the drydown, to me without reading the reviews, the soap didn't come to mind, tbh. Still quite a nice easy to wear, fresh and uplifting scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1360846"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1360846#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1359059" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1359059" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fluffypuffy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1341159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1341159.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fluffypuffy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1359059ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1359059" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1352551" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bergamotted"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328799"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1328799.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bergamotted" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1352551ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1352551" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); Sweet, but not headache-inducing. Dried down into a soapy clean floral, and it's pretty similar to any old generic hand cream/soap. It was still nice, I just didn't want to smell like soap. Not worth the price tag personally.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1352551"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1352551#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1345405" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1345405" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="niqazman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1340780"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1340780.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="niqazman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1345405ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1345405" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1340780">niqazman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-18">05/18/21 13:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought La Tulipe today after few weeks (or has it been months?) searching for a signature scent. I honestly wasn't expecting much from it because I was hyper-focused on other more famous scents that others have been raving about such as Gypsy water and Bald'afrique and I was so ready to buy either of these two, but it was only after the sale assistant sprayed La Tulipe on the card I was blown away by the opening note! It was beautiful and so simple (but it a good way!). It's a very straightforward scent nothing too complex. Came back the next day (which is today) to the shop and bought it straight away because I can't get the scent off of my mind. And that's how I know I've fallen in love with a scent (and I guess that's how scent memories are created and now La Tulipe by Byredo will always remind me of my spontaneous trip to Brown Thomas after my last day of class for Year 2 Medicine at Trinity College Dublin!)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250089">Jessica_Jones</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-14">01/14/21 15:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love. So pretty and cuddly. Actually now that I think about it I feel like this is how a little girl should smell. Like if I'm hugging my 7 year old giggling niece it would be adorable if she smelled like La Tulipe. <br />
Either way, there's no way I'm paying the full price for this. I tried 5 samples today and this was the first to disappear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1276082"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1276082#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1258449" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1258449" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ski4Ski"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201272"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1201272.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ski4Ski" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mizensir/Tres-Chere-45116.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45116.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tres Chere"title="Tres Chere"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1258449ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1258449" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201272">Ski4Ski</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-08">12/08/20 16:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>La Tulipe never fails to put a smile on my face each time I spray it. Never. To me, this smells like a pretty, fresh bouquet of high quality flowers - mildly sweet and very well blended. Great quality and simply beautiful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1258449"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1258449#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1254068" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1254068" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Siliaki"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1272437"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Siliaki" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1254068ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1254068" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1272437">Siliaki</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-28">11/28/20 12:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Whenever I wear this people around me ask "where does this smell come from?". A devil in disguise. It's not overwhelmingly sexy, nor mysterious, nor dangerous, nor even classy, yet it attracts people close to you like a magnet. <br />
It's fresh but not at all sporty. It's both warm and breezy and inoccent without being boring. If it were a woman she would have very long light brown hair, walking barefoot in a field of tulips in the first morning hours.  If you like complex perfumes you will hate this. If you like your perfumes bold, stay away. This is linear, straitforward, simple and it smells heavenly</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1254068"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1254068#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1215167" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1215167" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="katariina9"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229642"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.229642.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="katariina9" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Comme-des-Garcons/Comme-des-Garcons-Series-7-Sweet-Nomad-Tea-4378.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4378.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Comme des Garcons Series 7 Sweet: Nomad Tea"title="Comme des Garcons Series 7 Sweet: Nomad Tea"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1215167ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1215167" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229642">katariina9</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-23">08/23/20 11:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Mine is a shameless result of too much time spent in the tax-free part of the airport. Mind you, in the middle of winter, just before Christmas. But who cares if you find your favourite flower, with its meaty leaves, velvety petals, golden heart and slightly sour smell of first spring days, asking to be taken home? I did as ordered. And waited for a few months, until it was perfect time to wear La Tulipe.<br />
<br />
A beauty. Excellent creation by Byredo considering that tulips are the epitomes of spring, yet there are only a few varieties that have fragrant blossoms. Usually its everything else that smells fresh and peppery- bulbs, leaves, stems... La Tulipe captures all of it, plus lasts and projects well. Intoxicating dewy, fresh and feminine. Incredibly authentic-smelling, but not exactly a soliflore- you can also smell hyacinth, freesia and lilac in the background. But it has linear development, which for this particular scent is a huge plus in my book. A must for all the tulip-and spring-flower lovers and one of my favourite Byredos.<br />
<br />
EDIT June 2021: Got the La Tulipe small perfumed oil to go with the scent, and if used decent amount of oil under the perfume, it easily doubles the performance, projects really well like this too. My guess is that Byredo oils are there to extend the longevity and projection, works well, but a bit cheeky considering the total price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1215167"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1215167#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1212802" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/329711">wallywinthrop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-17">08/17/20 16:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful smooth slightly sweet velvety tulip/rhubarb/freesia, clean in the sense of the tiniest whisper of powder. Remember what Philosophy's Baby Grace used to smell like? Kind of a sweet tinge of mimosa. This is similar, to my nose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1212802"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1212802#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1209318" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
