align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1208166"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1208166#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1207809" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1207809" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="whoaboy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/989906"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.989906.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="whoaboy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Memoir-Woman-10146.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10146.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Memoir Woman"title="Memoir Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1207809ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1207809" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/989906">whoaboy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-05">08/05/20 07:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Quite a lovely spring scent. The tulip accord is my favorite part. Unfortunately, on me, it's a bit buried by the freesia and rhubarb top notes--even through dry down.<br />
<br />
<br />
Tulips have very little sweetness in their green, yeasty, earthy scent. I wish this fragrance had highlighted those notes more, instead of being mixed in and softened with the top notes. <br />
<br />
Still, I've been looking for years a fragrance that highlights tulips, this is as good as I've smelled so far.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1207809"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1207809#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1182323" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1182323" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lnoskin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1152284"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1152284.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lnoskin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juliette-Has-A-Gun/Not-A-Perfume-10296.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10296.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Not A Perfume"title="Not A Perfume"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1182323ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1182323" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1152284">lnoskin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-30">05/30/20 20:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very realistic floral scent. Very feminine and pretty. It does smell a bit like shampoo but not in a bad way. I also pick up a bit of powder. Others have said they smell musk, I do not smell any musk. I got about 5mls in a giveaway and definitely will use it up but I don't think I will purchase the full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1182323"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1182323#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1177602" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1177602" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Timaka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1177300"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1177300.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Timaka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1177602ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1177602" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1177300">Timaka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-19">05/19/20 07:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening of La Tulipe was very promising: crisp, a bit green and quite authentic tulip. A few hours later it just smells like luxury hotel shampoo. Dont get me wrong, its still nice - just wish it stayed fresh and bright (and true to its name). I think you could easily find something similar and cheaper from the brand Clean. Projection is soft, longevity seems decent enough.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1177602"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1177602#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1175080" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1175080" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MarisaM666"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205751"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MarisaM666" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Noir-de-Noir-1822.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1822.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Noir de Noir"title="Noir de Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1175080ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1175080" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205751">MarisaM666</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-13">05/13/20 05:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If someone was to blind buy this perfume and asked me what it smells like, I would say, fresh, clean (or cleaner) type of scent. Could easily be a fabric softener scent as others have mentioned. (my boyfriend went for tile cleaner, lol) it's definitely synthetic smelling. I prefer Blanche from that line, it's more of a fresh clean laundry left to dry in the sun kinda smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1175080"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1175080#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1173011" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1173011" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cal2601"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236025"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1236025.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cal2601" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Eau-de-Soleil-Blanc-48152.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48152.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau de Soleil Blanc"title="Eau de Soleil Blanc"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1173011ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1173011" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236025">Cal2601</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-08">05/08/20 05:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I unashamedly love white florals. La Tulipe is fresh, pretty, feminine and not overly heavy or cloying. The perfect fragrance for lunch out in spring or summer, sillage is arms length, maybe a little more, longevity is about 6 hours on me. I feel pretty when I wear this which is exactly why I bought it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1173011"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1173011#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1166765" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1166765" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dreamsgourmet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1200798"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1200798.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dreamsgourmet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/En-Passant-2793.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2793.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="En Passant"title="En Passant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1166765ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1166765" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1200798">dreamsgourmet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-22">04/22/20 13:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first sniff, I am reminded of liquid benadrylvery medicinal and powdery. Quickly settles down into a very smooth, soft, clean fragrance. Evocative of baby shampoo, or freshly laundered clothes. I like woody and green notes in my perfumes, but I personally don't pick up on either of those in this one. Don't really get any vetiver either. On my skin, it's all soft edges, characteristic Byredo coolness, nothing sharp or warm about it. Low sillage, but I think that fits with the personality of this fragrance. If it was very strong, I think it would be headache-inducing.<br />
<br />
It's a pretty and inoffensive scent. I don't dislike it, and it would be pleasant to smell it on someone else, but it's personally not one that I'd reach for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1166765"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1166765#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1154495" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1154495" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Unfurling Blossoms"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1220411"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1220411.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Unfurling Blossoms" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-de-Lierre-Eau-de-Toilette-6500.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6500.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau de Lierre Eau de Toilette"title="Eau de Lierre Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1154495ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1154495" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1220411">Unfurling Blossoms</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-03-12">03/12/20 15:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Does not smell like a photorealistic flower but instead smells like a fabric softener with some dryer sheets.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1154495"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1154495#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1150391" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1150391" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="margoess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/387523"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.387523.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="margoess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/In-Love-Again-104.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.104.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="In Love Again"title="In Love Again"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1150391ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1150391" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/387523">margoess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-28">02/28/20 18:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There are fleeting moments in the opening minutes of La Tulipe where I can smell the most vivid, lovely, fresh-cut stems and wet, delicate petals... if I'm holding my nose riiight up to my arm. These moments are truly beautiful, but then it all too quickly fades into something that smells like dishwashing soap or baby shampoo (*nice* soap or baby shampoo... but still). <br />
<br />
It's winter now, so I wonder if slightly warmer weather wouldn't help La Tulipe bloom a little bit louder; and I haven't yet tried more than 1-2 test sprays at a time. Maybe if I sprayed generously? Drink more water and moisturize lavishly? The opening is so beautiful, and even the shampoo notes are pleasingso clean, so upliftingI would love to be able to smell them more! <br />
<br />
In spite of the difficulty that I'm having smelling this fragrance, I find myself wanting a bottle. There's something about the minimalistic theme of the scent + the design of the bottle + the straightforward nameit's all working for me and making me want this to work. If any of you are holding on to any La Tulipe pro tips, please PM me. I want to know your secrets!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1150391"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1150391#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1148244" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1148244" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Angeldna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1227821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Angeldna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Parfum-49100.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49100.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Parfum"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1148244ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1148244" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227821">Angeldna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-22">02/22/20 13:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, Byredo is no joke! This smells like a real tulip! I even smell the stem! The question is, Do I want to smell like a tulip? Hmmmm...I think I do. Hubby didnt like it. He said he didnt like it twice and that it makes him think of a funeral home. I dont recall seeing many tulips in funeral homes...carnations maybe, but tulips...no. Then again, does anyone really notice the flowers when there is a dead loved-one in the room? Anyway, I like it! Lol</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1148244"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1148244#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1105652" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1105652" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Eupatoria"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/922756"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Eupatoria" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Hermessence-Cardamusc-48133.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48133.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hermessence Cardamusc"title="Hermessence Cardamusc"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1105652ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1105652" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/922756">Eupatoria</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-10">10/10/19 21:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Honestly, I never realized tulips can have a scent until doing some internet research. The varieties I buy every spring don't seem to have any particular scent... must look for more fragrant varieties.<br />
<br />
To me, this perfume smells like mimosa, just a little bit more complex than Fragonard's Mimosa, at a much higher price (and I am generally not the one to complain about a price tag). It smells like an expensive florist shop in the spring -- which is honestly a great thing.<br />
<br />
It's a nice perfume -- light, inoffensive, unusual, elegant. Just the right amount of flowery and fresh. Would be great for office wear. Would make a great gift -- hard to imagine someone who wouldn't like the season. <br />
<br />
Regular longevity and silage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1105652"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1105652#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1096565" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1096565" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="missk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7262"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7262.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="missk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Donna-Karan/DKNY-Be-Delicious-Fresh-Blossom-Juiced-11127.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11127.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="DKNY Be Delicious Fresh Blossom Juiced"title="DKNY Be Delicious Fresh Blossom Juiced"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1096565ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1096565" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7262">missk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-09-11">09/11/19 05:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Byredo's La Tulipe is hands down my favourite from this niche brand. This revelation surprises me. I'm usually one to fall in love with oriental scents, and Byredo has no shortage of spicy, woodsy, incense-rich fragrances in their line. This dew-kissed, green floral has thrown me for a loop, and I'm not complaining.<br />
<br />
Freesia is one of La Tulipe's most dominant floral accords, which is surprisingly a note that on most occasions hates my skin chemistry. Thankfully, the freesia in La Tulipe works beautifully on my skin, and for that I am grateful. <br />
<br />
Fragrant tulip species are hard to come by, but they do exist. There's no denying that their vibrant coloured blooms are aesthetically pleasing, and I think La Tulipe has captured the essence of a bouquet of tulips quite well. <br />
<br />
This is a beautifully composed fresh, green floral with clean nuances. I long for warm Spring days spent lounging in the sunshine whenever I smell this masterpiece. I am dumbfounded as to how La Tulipe is not as popular as Gypsy Water and Bal d'Afrique. Fragrance is subjective, but in so saying I can't see how anyone could be turned off by this fragrance.<br />
<br />
The opening blend of cyclamen and freesia does smell reminiscent of powdery lilac in some instances. The scent development begins as a fresh garden after the rain, before transcending into a sweet laundry-esque aroma. The base notes retain the floral sweetness with a touch of dry, grassy vetiver thrown into the mix.<br />
<br />
I must have this fragrance for Spring as I feel that my collection is lacking without it. Most importantly, I have finally found a freesia fragrance that works for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1096565"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1096565#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1091863" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1091863" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bubbles1964"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1095199.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bubbles1964" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bastide-Aix-en-Provence/Lavande-in-Love-62387.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62387.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lavande in Love"title="Lavande in Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1091863ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1091863" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199">Bubbles1964</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-27">08/27/19 07:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I get a slight powdery, I stuck my head in a florists flower refrigerator coolness from this scent. I dont think tulips have much of a scent unless you have a hundred of them. <br />
<br />
Blended so that nothing sticks out, I dont pick up rhubarb or freesia or any other notes. An airy, fresh, linear floral only fading during the drydown. Theres a mainstream department store feeling here, nothing challenging to place it in the niche camp, but very easy to like. <br />
<br />
Lots of complaints about La Tulipe lasting only a few hours, and for me thats about the amount of time I could handle smelling like a florist shop, so not a complaint but it is a pass. A lukewarm like from me.<br />
<br />
EDIT: I stand corrected. In 2020 I became obsessed with double tulips there are dozens of fragrant tulip varieties, in fact I grow many of them in my garden including Exotic Emperor, Angelique, Mondial and Finola.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1091863"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1091863#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1088616" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; certainly a scent to please self and others</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1088616"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1088616#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1084711" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1064111">Carpe Noctem</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-04">08/04/19 14:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a strong like from me, but not a love. For the first ten minutes it's kind of overpowering. So strong and in-your-face. I think it does smell like a tulip. I used to grow them but of course this smell is much stronger than the natural flower. I smell the green notes, the tulips and the woodsy smells most. Thankfully Freesia is not overtaking this scent. <br />
<br />
I would seriously think about buying this if I hadn't already fallen in love with Flowerhead first, and that one is a love. Still, La Tulipe is a beautiful floral that, once it calms down, is very smooth and pleasant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1084711"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1084711#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1072862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Although I love the scent and I'm not usually a fan of freesia.  It's airy and light.  It smells exactly what fresh flowers smell like and I enjoy it while it lasts.  I couldn't imagine buying a full bottle when it only lasts 2-3 hours tops.  I even had my daughter try and smell it and she could barely smell it at the 2 1/2 hour mark.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1072862"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1072862#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1057018" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
