padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/941289">what is this I don&#039;t even</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-04">05/04/19 09:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A pretty and sweet green-pink mixed floral. Silage and longevity are terrible, though, and so sadly not worth the price of a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1057018"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1057018#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1030834" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1030834" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content=".tho"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1180773"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt=".tho" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3575.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gypsy Water"title="Gypsy Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1030834ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1030834" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1180773">.tho</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-02-13">02/13/19 03:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I had tried this before I bought it, but now when I spray it, I think its too floral for me. Im more into fruity, goumand fragrances<br />
So Im gonna give this to my mom<br />
Also it doesnt last on me, I sprayed 4-5 times and I still can not smell it on me<br />
With that high price, I have to say that Im disappointed</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1030834"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1030834#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1021640" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1021640" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="evster"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/474037"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.474037.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="evster" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Jasmin-Rouge-12765.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12765.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jasmin Rouge"title="Jasmin Rouge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1021640ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1021640" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/474037">evster</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-17">01/17/19 15:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A dear friend of mine gave me La Tulipe, as she initially purchased it for herself but she found herself not reaching for it that much. It's definitely one of the nicer Byredo creations; in the past I've been let down by the brand, expecting so much from the hype it's built up, only to experience something lackluster and rather one-dimensional. This one is not bad, but like my friend, I rarely pick up this one above other ones in my wardrobe. <br />
<br />
La Tulipe opens up green, and I definitely get the tulip, or a field of tulips, after a spring rain. It's not tulips on a bright sunny day, but rather wet tulips in early April when it's still a bit chilly. It's refreshing, and inoffensive, like a baby shampoo. Like all other Byredo perfumes I've tried, this one is quite one dimensional from the start to finish-- this could be a good thing or a bad thing depending on what you expect out of a perfume. For me, I like more enigmatic perfumes that develop and bloom.<br />
<br />
This could be someone's signature scent, I can see this one working year-round, as it's not TOO green either, but just green enough to put you in a bright mood. Very office safe, as it doesn't have a huge sillage either. I like La Tulipe enough but not sure if I will purchse it with my own money. There are so many interesting, better quality perfumes out there for the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1021640"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1021640#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1013840" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1013840" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LaUna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72784"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.72784.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LaUna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Keiko-Mecheri/Gourmandises-2711.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2711.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gourmandises"title="Gourmandises"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1013840ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1013840" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72784">LaUna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-27">12/27/18 09:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was looking for a tulip scent and after many recommendations chose to order a sample of this.<br />
It is very mild pleasant, clean shampoo like floral; soft, white florals and tulips as primary notes. It smells like lots of other white floral scents outthere, Think I have smelled this before on others. Typical springtime scent, floral bloom.<br />
I really like the initial spray on. Drydown part turns stuffy and unflattering on my skin. Since it is on a pricey side, I shall test it out some more before deciding to purchase it....</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1013840"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1013840#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1010182" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1010182" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sorenza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/402697"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.402697.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sorenza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/High-Line-7503.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7503.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="High Line"title="High Line"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1010182ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1010182" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/402697">sorenza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-15">12/15/18 10:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To my nose, tulips have no smell except something very green and fresh, like flower stems. That's what La Tulipe smells like plus some clean soapy notes. <br />
It's very pleasant and office-friendly. Actually I wore it at work and a few colleagues said it smelled very good in the room...  this happened again in a room where I teach. When entering, a kid said: "It smells like babies!" and another one answered: "No, it smells like soap!". And it happened again in another classroom: " It smells good! It smells like soap! Who just sprayed on deodorant?"<br />
So I was very surprised to get noticed because people usually don't say anything (maybe they dare not say anything when the perfume is disturbing).<br />
The lasting power is average. I'd say 3 to 4 hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1010182"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1010182#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1000624" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1000624" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="damienthoresson"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1016817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1016817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="damienthoresson" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1000624ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1000624" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1016817">damienthoresson</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-13">11/13/18 17:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very pleasant surprise for me. Byredo usually seem to rule the nothing scent game with a bunch of banal your skin but better blah blah releases, yet stuff like this and Pulp knock everything out of the ball park. Granted, this is a very light and feminine fragrance like many of the others ... but this one has a personality and actually tells a story. <br />
<br />
Tulips dont really smell of anything, but like camellia and Une Fleur de Chanel, Byredo have created a fairly interesting take on the almost scentless flower. Airy, for the feminine / femmes / feminine at heart / dudes in touch with their feminine side. Just really nice, honestly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="1000624"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=1000624#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent970226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc970226" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Michelle12345678"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1014935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1014935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Michelle12345678" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Gold-70015.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70015.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold +"title="Gold +"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma970226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd970226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1014935">Michelle12345678</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-08-09">08/09/18 12:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Light, soapy, baby soap, shampoo. Light, airy floral with some green underpinnings. Inoffensive. Clean. I can't really get too excited about it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="970226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=970226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent959937" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc959937" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="natasha.wahyudihardjo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/207549"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="natasha.wahyudihardjo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Chinatown-1300.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1300.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chinatown"title="Chinatown"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma959937ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd959937" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/207549">natasha.wahyudihardjo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-08">07/08/18 20:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is heaven, and that is not an exaggeration.  One thing I have always adored from Byredo is that they always incorporate rare notes in their perfumes, tulips and marigold (in Bal d'afrique) being two examples. I'm so stoked everytime I sniff their perfume. Yes, they are very expensive, but I admire their uniqueness. <br />
<br />
La Tulipe smells like crushed tulips and leaves mixed in fresh water (Fiji water, I suppose). I do think that it can be a bit peppery and spicy when sprayed on fabrics. On the skin, it is much softer and simply heavenly. This fragrance makes me happy and in my years of loving perfume, Byredo is one brand that makes very distinctive perfumes that actually smell very different one another. You don't get that with popular and celebrity scents. Love it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="959937"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=959937#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent942644" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc942644" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SailorV"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/955817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.955817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SailorV" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma942644ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd942644" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/955817">SailorV</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-14">05/14/18 12:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Some people say tulips don't have a scent, but I have sniffed many different tulips in flower shops and some of them do have one. La Tulipe has a distinct tulip note, but all the tulips I have smelled had a softer scent. This starts very clean and green, a bit biting, like hyacinths, lily of the valley (my horror note!) and even lilac can sometimes smell in perfume. Potentially headache-inducing to those of us who find green florals a bit screeching.<br />
<br />
When it dries down, it becomes nicer and warms up. I can really smell the rhubarb, which I love, and even a bit of natural green spiciness. <br />
Still, this is not my kind of floral. I liked it at the Byredo counter when the saleswoman sprayed it on paper, but on my skin, it doesn't work for me. Too cool, green and sharp. But if those adjectives sound good to you, it could work, it's not a bad scent per se. Just not something I would want around me all day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="942644"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=942644#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent933583" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc933583" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="julisema"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/944836"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.944836.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="julisema" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Crivelli/Oud-Cadenza-95195.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95195.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Cadenza"title="Oud Cadenza"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma933583ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd933583" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/944836">julisema</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-04-17">04/17/18 03:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very light scent, but really long lasting. Soft, very feminine. One of the best Byredo creations for spring season. All the time smell tulip and freesia notes as well as green notes. The best thing in this scent that it fits good young girls as well as elder women. Its so classy for my nose. And what I really like that this tulip smells so natural, not as sintetic as other.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="933583"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=933583#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent926376" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc926376" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LisaMari"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/686537"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.686537.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LisaMari" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma926376ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd926376" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/686537">LisaMari</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-26">03/26/18 15:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried the hair perfume of this. Opens with a fresh citrusy floral and a little powder ..but then it starts to smell like chips.. seriously, on my hair anyway then it dries down to a kind of savoury powder and then its completely gone in only 3 hours... good projection poor longevity</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="926376"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=926376#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent926062" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc926062" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="indigo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20906"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.20906.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="indigo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Feminite-du-Bois-5749.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5749.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Feminit du Bois"title="Feminit du Bois"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma926062ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd926062" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20906">indigo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-25">03/25/18 14:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The tulips I've encountered in real life have no smell. I do have an Australian made tulip scented candle though, &amp; this smells just like it - so I guess they must have (perhaps when growing en masse?)<br />
Anyway, the candle smells great &amp; I was really pleased to get a sample of La Tulipe &amp; find that same lovely scent in a perfume.<br />
It's an airy Spring flower floral which also captures the delicacy &amp; slight waxiness of the petals somehow. Pure &amp; fresh smelling, it actually reminds me of the scent of English wild bluebells. It is neither powdery or soapy on my skin, just a natural smelling light (non-white) floral.<br />
The longevity &amp; silage are not great, after about 4 hours it's a faint whisper of a skin scent on me. Never mind, sometimes I just want something that smells beautiful, soft, &amp; simple.<br />
I can't imagine anyone finding this offensive, &amp; I think it'd be hard to over spray this one. It's lovely &amp; I'm going to get a full bottle - which I happily intend to douse myself in :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="926062"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=926062#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent924871" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc924871" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cheiro-bom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1117276"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1117276.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cheiro-bom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6458.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bal d'Afrique"title="Bal d'Afrique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma924871ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd924871" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1117276">cheiro-bom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-22">03/22/18 09:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume has absolutely no projection and it's so fleeting, on my skin it lasts 1-2 hours max. It's a very soft, powdery floral scent that reminds me of Frederic Malle L'Eau d'Hiver, although the Byredo version is more linear. I look for perfumes with a bit more oomph, so this one is not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="924871"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=924871#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent911856" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc911856" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="annettepe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/219457"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.219457.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="annettepe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/Irish-Leather-18393.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18393.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Irish Leather"title="Irish Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma911856ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd911856" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/219457">annettepe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-15">02/15/18 02:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought the hair spray version of La Tulipe and also received a sample size of the perfume. I must confirm that the hair spray and perfume are 100% identical in scents. I am so in love with this fragrance. It is absolutely beautiful. <br />
<br />
I must say the name is a little bit misleading. It is not at all a heavy floral as "La Tulipe" suggests. Instead it is a very clean, watery, airy type of soft florals. More like the scent of tulip gardens on a big bed of grass in the crisp morning after a whole night of rain. The watery green notes gives it a feeling of freshness, as if you just got out from the shower. I could also describe this scent as an expensive luxury soap you would receive in luxury palace hotels. Overall, beautiful, simple, elegant, classic. Incredibly wearable as it would not offend your surroundings. It is so versatile as you can wear it anytime of the day. I am currently wearing it during the winter, and I am pleasantly surprised by how it evolves and heightens the crisp and wateriness of the scent. I would also imagine it would be perfect for the summer as it is a light fragrance, unlike many floral scents that could easily be nauseating under the hot weather.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="911856"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=911856#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent874086" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc874086" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yzmo91"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/162565"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.162565.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="yzmo91" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma874086ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd874086" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/162565">yzmo91</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-25">10/25/17 10:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful clean 'realistic' idea of a floral perfume. It is unpretentious and has a humbling smell, it does not shout. The notes are nicely blended, a safe fragrance and not at all in your face. This is nice if you want to smell something that's natural and uncomplicatedly beautiful. This is the kind of perfume where you appreciate its minimalism.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="874086"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=874086#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent854991" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc854991" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aspirina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/128870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.128870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aspirina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Eaudemoiselle-de-Givenchy-Ambre-Velours-18920.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18920.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eaudemoiselle de Givenchy Ambre Velours"title="Eaudemoiselle de Givenchy Ambre Velours"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma854991ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd854991" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/128870">aspirina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-08-26">08/26/17 13:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Translucent vegetal, fresh, probably unisex, green, office friendly, skin scent, overpriced, overpriced, overpriced. <br />
 I get almost nothing from this scent, completely minimalist. It also reminds me of some old fashioned baby soap scent. <br />
 I guess you can wear this to bed, or when wearing a summery white dress..it is certainly relaxing. Not full bottle worthy in my opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="854991"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=854991#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent831952" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc831952" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="landshark321"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/888664"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.888664.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="landshark321" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma831952ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd831952" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/888664">landshark321</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-06-13">06/13/17 11:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Byredo La Tulipe is a very agreeable floral fragrance, certainly inherently geared toward female wearers in the conventional sense, but very nicely balanced, especially as it dries down.<br />
<br />
It's mainly tulips, with some other florals mixed, and the main element that's mixed in the dry down is vetiver, to my nose, and perhaps a little musk.<br />
<br />
Slightly fresh, slightly herbal, almost borderline citrus-smelling, though without any listed citrus notes.<br />
<br />
Performance is adequate, certainly better than the Gypsy Water EDC but certainly not as robust as more of the cold-weather-leaning Byredo options.<br />
<br />
Definitely one of the nicer Byredo offerings I've tried to date.  Nothing something of which I'd buy a full bottle, but a pleasant one to wear.<br />
<br />
7 out of 10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="831952"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=831952#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent830000" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc830000" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="b.gracious"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/382391"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.382391.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="b.gracious" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma830000ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd830000" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/382391">b.gracious</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-06-07">06/07/17 11:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Scent - vetiver, watered tulips &amp; woods.<br />
<br />
Season/Time of Day - I prefer to use this one in the warmer months, day or night.<br />
<br />
Projection - I didn't get noticed, I didn't get a compliment.<br />
<br />
Longevity - I get 12hrs consistently.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="830000"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=830000#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent821305" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc821305" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Virgoesque"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1017381"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1017381.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Virgoesque" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Homecourt/Cocomoi-96791.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96791.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cocomoi"title="Cocomoi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma821305ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd821305" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1017381">Virgoesque</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-09">05/09/17 22:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>La Tulipe is very soft floral, it's actually kind of amazing how soft it is...and it smells like lilac to me. Do tulips resemble lilacs in scent? Anyway, it's very pretty, feminine, and light. Medium longevity. It is linear, but I like it very much. Really nice for spring!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="821305"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=821305#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent812482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc812482" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Winter Sweet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/265655"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.265655.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Winter Sweet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma812482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd812482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);
