It does not smell like a florist shop at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="812482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=812482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent811274" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc811274" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="virga"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/49549"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="virga" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma811274ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd811274" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/49549">virga</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-10">04/10/17 12:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>La Tulipe Byredo - the most realistic tulip, even more real than actual flower. Waxy leaves and cold musky heart. The smell of spring.  Thats art and I dont even think about this fragrance as something I could or would like to wear.  As a fragrance, its very one dimensional, longevity average. Very close to skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="811274"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=811274#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent809755" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc809755" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jenny.Baby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1045111"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1045111.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jenny.Baby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Viktoria-Minya/Hedonist-Iris-28678.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28678.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hedonist Iris"title="Hedonist Iris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma809755ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd809755" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1045111">Jenny.Baby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-06">04/06/17 00:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A lovely green light flowery perfume. It don t think it smells like tulips, but more like a visual impression of tulips turned into a scent.<br />
La Tulipe is quite rich in aldehydes. <br />
<br />
It's kind of similar to the Clean-perfumes, but in my mind more interesting.<br />
It doesn't last very long on my skin, but I like it a lot</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="809755"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=809755#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent809746" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc809746" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jyrhara"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/122251"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.122251.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jyrhara" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bottega-Verde/Magnolia-Nera-24513.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.24513.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Magnolia Nera"title="Magnolia Nera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma809746ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd809746" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/122251">Jyrhara</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-05">04/05/17 23:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Uplifting is the perfect word to describe this beautiful green floral. It's like spraying on your daily dose of vitamins before going to work. The most prominent notes on my skin are the greenery and freesia, then rhubarb and a hint of vetiver. Not much development, but it's not needed, as it's not something you'd wear at night.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="809746"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=809746#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent789256" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc789256" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="delightfully absurd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1044925"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="delightfully absurd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma789256ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd789256" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1044925">delightfully absurd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-04">02/04/17 12:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I expected to be let down by this because of some negative reviews I read about it, but I actually found it beautiful. It doesn't resemble anything else I've tried, it's fresh and light, very uplifting. I've been wearing it for more than 9 hours and it's still there. Perhaps it's linear but in this case I think it works. Sometimes it's disappointing when a great opening dries down into a rather boring scent, this is not the case here, the dry down is the same kind of fresh as the opening. It's subtle but it has character.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="789256"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=789256#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent781507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc781507" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Addict2Perfume"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/156824"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.156824.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Addict2Perfume" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ormonde-Jayne/Damask-60086.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60086.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Damask"title="Damask"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma781507ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd781507" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/156824">Addict2Perfume</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-01-14">01/14/17 16:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>La Tulipe by Byredo smells like dewy, green tulip stems with fresh freesia that has a fruity aquatic undertone tone from the rhubarb and the cyclamen. I tried Flowerhead and found it to been a very sharp screechy jasmine that was so potent it drowned out the other floral notes. I love floral fragrances and La Tulipe has the perfect balance of both floral and green notes. This is no ordinary backyard garden tulip  this is rolling grassy hills full of wild tulips, covered in a crisp morning mist amongst the shady trees deep in the forest. It is very fresh, feminine, and easy to wear!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="781507"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=781507#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent764368" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc764368" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="glamgirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/82912"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="glamgirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma764368ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd764368" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/82912">glamgirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-11-25">11/25/16 12:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tulip and freesia are some of my favorite scents, but they are nowhere to be seen here.<br />
<br />
Overwhelmingly flowery. After a few hours, I just wanted the smell to go away.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="764368"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=764368#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent750995" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc750995" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shoppingdoll"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1024185"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shoppingdoll" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Parfums-de-Rosine/Ballerina-No-3-34610.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34610.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ballerina No 3"title="Ballerina No 3"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma750995ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd750995" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1024185">Shoppingdoll</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-11">10/11/16 02:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pure Spring in a bottle although I love it year round. Clean, fresh, energetic, wakes you up in the morning. A happy scent for sure. Definitely get the tulip note on me. Projection and sillage are good on this one. Would put it as a mid-strength scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="750995"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=750995#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent743083" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc743083" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="StellaDiverFlynn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/475352"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.475352.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="StellaDiverFlynn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dame-Perfumery/Chocolate-Perfume-Oil-43159.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43159.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chocolate Perfume Oil"title="Chocolate Perfume Oil"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma743083ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd743083" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/475352">StellaDiverFlynn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-09-16">09/16/16 14:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Byredo La Tulipe opens on my skin in the way that a fresh bloom is emerging from earth: the flowery part has not yet awaken, the plant itself is mostly a verdancy with a delicate, earthy, dirt-like nuance, all layered over a soapy white musk with a subtle salty touch. <br />
<br />
Soon, the flower blossoms, and the white musk also grows stronger. I'm not very familiar with freesia, therefore I mostly perceive the combined accord of soapiness and delicate white floral as linden blossom in perfumery. Later on, when the flower gets more honeyed, I'm more reminded of jasmine. But the overall effect is not dissimilar from a few floral woody musk fragrances. I wasn't able to discern rhubarb at first, its tart fruitiness combined with the creaminess of jasmine petals reminded me of not-yet-ripen bananas. It's only in the late dry down that I get the earthy yet tart fruity rhubarb.<br />
<br />
The sillage is moderate to soft, and the longevity is around 8 hours. Hazy feeling on the whole, but still with various subtle nuances, La Tulipe would make a very enjoyable floral woody musk fragrance for everyday wear, even though the white musk is too overwhelming for my taste. I would recommend giving it a try to those who are looking for an inoffensive fragrance featuring clean white musk and abstract spring floral, but I think there are other more accessible fragrances with similar effects as well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="743083"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=743083#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent738538" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc738538" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="scain54"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/124762"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.124762.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="scain54" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma738538ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd738538" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/124762">scain54</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-09-02">09/02/16 10:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really nice!  La Tulipe is the type of fragrance that gives you the whole flower experience  -  stem, leaves, petals and pollen. Moderate sillage, super longevity.  I sprayed on just a little last night before bed, and it's still lingering. Must be my body chemistry, as I see others say it doesn't last that long on them.  It's really a happy scent, one of those that makes you smile.  My favorite of all the Byredos!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="738538"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=738538#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent738532" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc738532" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="saulyna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/180540"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="saulyna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Black-Saffron-16220.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16220.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Saffron"title="Black Saffron"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma738532ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd738532" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/180540">saulyna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-09-02">09/02/16 10:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Well, i have worn this for a few times and just realized that the dry down on me reminds me  of Versace Chrystal Noir. Not totally the same, but quite similar, with some soft greenish floweriness. Overall La Tulipe has that slightly earthy undertone, exactly as you can smell when you put your nose into the tulip blossom. Very comforting. Not exactly as clean as some others have described it. Beautiful and unique.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="738532"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=738532#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent731565" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc731565" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mohsen95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mohsen95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma731565ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd731565" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817">mohsen95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-11">08/11/16 01:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>6/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="731565"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=731565#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent724068" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc724068" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="onaona"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32559"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.32559.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="onaona" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ex-Nihilo/Honore-Delights-64803.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64803.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Honor Delights"title="Honor Delights"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma724068ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd724068" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32559">onaona</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-07-16">07/16/16 16:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>White.<br />
Not virginal or angelic.  <br />
Not fluffy or cloud-like.<br />
White<br />
<br />
While I'm at it, it's also NOT tulip-like :) <br />
<br />
Well, at least not to my nose.  NOW, that's not a bad thing.  I absolutely adore this non-tulip-like, tulip fragrance! <br />
<br />
La Tulipe is BEAUTIFUL and well...white!  I get a white soap, or maybe even a white stick deodorant note. I had no idea I wanted to smell exactly LIKE this.  As I try to describe it in my head, I'm not sure anyone else will want to smell like this by my inadequate description, BUT you will...once you are lucky enough to experience it.  <br />
<br />
Other notes beside WHITE?<br />
I think what I'm smelling is freesia, but if so...it's the cleanest, loveliest  freesia I've ever encountered <br />
The listed green notes may, MAY include violet leaves.  It's hard to tell, the green is less prominent to my nose than it appears to be to fragrance voters here.  It's an enhancer of the white for me.  Freesia frequently has a hint of green to me, so maybe it's responsible or possibly the rhubarb? A green toss up :)<br />
There's also a dash of pepper, unlisted.  My nose tickle says it's there.<br />
<br />
I'm betting some find this a little boring.  Pretty, but 'boring'. I'm ok with that.  <br />
I don't always need whistles and bells and bright colors.  Some days I need Byredo La Stick Deodorant to feel, kinda tulip-like and very, very pretty.  In white, of course.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8441"comment_id="724068"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/La-Tulipe-8441.html?ccid=724068#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent714138" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc714138" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sizzler"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/74577"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.74577.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sizzler" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Do-Son-Eau-de-Parfum-49098.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49098.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Do Son Eau de Parfum"title="Do Son Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma714138ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd714138" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/74577">Sizzler</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-11">06/11/16 18:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gorgeous opening! Lovely green floral, fairly unique. I do not get any rhubarb, and I don't think it's overly sweet. Perfect airy springtime fragrance, without the 'hairspray' note. So charmed, I ordered a decant. Over time it slowly calms to a sheer wood and creamy cosmetics dry down (Cosmone?). I can't imagine this offending in any setting. I like the concept of creating a scent for a flower, tulip, which has almost no fragrance associated with it, and, therefore, no preconceived notions.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
